channel.title: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?
channel.description: I would really like this so that i have every song, manually recording them takes forever

item.title: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:11, topic:551475”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670391.msg4483274#msg4483274 date=1431872722]

You’ll have to use Jagex’ midi-player to play the files if it is true that they use custom instruments.

i guess i can’t get jagex’s midi-player then or…?

Find a deob’d client and rip the midi player from there.
Idk how many renamed ones have the player still in it (A lot of people for some reason remove the code for the player. My client doesn’t even load the sound index )
[/quote]

They’re not removed from the client. The player was written in a JavaScript file rather than being part of the client. Some developers add it into the client but it isn’t there by default.[/quote]
TIL. lol.

OP: You could google for a midi player… As Ambokile stated, some people have wrote one, so chances are there will be a source for one.

Read full topic
item.source: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?

item.title: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?
item.dc:creator: @TheHeroOfTime TheHeroOfTime
item.description:
@TheHeroOfTime wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:11, topic:551475”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670391.msg4483274#msg4483274 date=1431872722]

You’ll have to use Jagex’ midi-player to play the files if it is true that they use custom instruments.

i guess i can’t get jagex’s midi-player then or…?

Find a deob’d client and rip the midi player from there.
Idk how many renamed ones have the player still in it (A lot of people for some reason remove the code for the player. My client doesn’t even load the sound index )
[/quote]

They’re not removed from the client. The player was written in a JavaScript file rather than being part of the client. Some developers add it into the client but it isn’t there by default.[/quote]

hmm could you help me with this then ?

Read full topic
item.source: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?

item.title: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:551475”][quote author=TheHeroOfTime link=topic=670391.msg4483267#msg4483267 date=1431862970]

You’ll have to use Jagex’ midi-player to play the files if it is true that they use custom instruments.

i guess i can’t get jagex’s midi-player then or…?
[/quote]
Find a deob’d client and rip the midi player from there.
Idk how many renamed ones have the player still in it (A lot of people for some reason remove the code for the player. My client doesn’t even load the sound index )[/quote]

They’re not removed from the client. The player was written in a JavaScript file rather than being part of the client. Some developers add it into the client but it isn’t there by default.

Read full topic
item.source: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?

item.title: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“TheHeroOfTime, post:9, topic:551475”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=670391.msg4483015#msg4483015 date=1431560799]
You’ll have to use Jagex’ midi-player to play the files if it is true that they use custom instruments.
[/quote]

i guess i can’t get jagex’s midi-player then or…?[/quote]
Find a deob’d client and rip the midi player from there.
Idk how many renamed ones have the player still in it (A lot of people for some reason remove the code for the player. My client doesn’t even load the sound index )

Read full topic

item.title: Extracting Jagex Cache to obtain music?
item.dc:creator: @TheHeroOfTime TheHeroOfTime
item.description:

sinisoul:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,670229.0.html

no no nonono no no nonono no no no.

this again is odd-sounding music like i hear it on every topic… to describe what i mean,

from game recorded manually: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvEeGQSwNX4
from other topics, youtube, etc: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OyKj4gJ_Sl0
theres a clear difference

thanks for trying to help tho
